com.microblink.uisettings

Class BasicScanUISettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microblink.uisettings.UISettings
      • com.microblink.uisettings.BasicScanUISettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BeepSoundUIOptions, CameraSettingsUIOptions, DebugImageListenerUIOptions, HelpIntentUIOptions, HighResSuccessFrameCaptureUIOptions, SplashScreenUIOptions
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarcodeUISettings, BaseOcrUISettings

    public abstract class BasicScanUISettings
extends UISettings
implements DebugImageListenerUIOptions, SplashScreenUIOptions, CameraSettingsUIOptions, BeepSoundUIOptions, HighResSuccessFrameCaptureUIOptions, HelpIntentUIOptions

      • saveToIntent

        public final void saveToIntent(@NonNull
                               android.content.Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: UISettings
        Saves this scan activity settings to Intent so it can be passed to the corresponding scan activity. Intent target activity must be set before calling this method, and target activity must be compatible with this settings. DO NOT USE THIS METHOD UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. Improper usage will crash your app.
        Overrides:
        saveToIntent in class UISettings
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent to which this scan activity settings should be saved.

      • setCameraAspectMode

        public final void setCameraAspectMode(@Nullable
                                      CameraAspectMode cameraAspectMode)
        Defines which camera aspect mode will be used. If set to CameraAspectMode.ASPECT_FIT (default), then camera preview will be letterboxed inside available view space. If set to CameraAspectMode.ASPECT_FILL, camera preview will be zoomed and cropped to use the entire view space.
        Parameters:
        cameraAspectMode - camera aspect mode that will be used.

      • getCameraOptimizedForNearScanning

        public final boolean getCameraOptimizedForNearScanning()
        Returns whether camera parameters should be optimized for near object scanning.
        Returns:
        true if camera parameters should be optimized for near object scanning, false otherwise.

      • setCameraOptimizedForNearScanning

        public final void setCameraOptimizedForNearScanning(boolean cameraOptimizedForNearScanning)
        Defines whether camera parameters should be optimized for near object scanning. When camera parameters are optimized for near object scanning, macro focus mode will be preferred over autofocus mode. Thus, camera will have easier time focusing on to near objects, but might have harder time focusing on far objects. If you expect that most of your scans will be performed by holding the device very near the object, turn on that parameter. By default, this parameter is set to false, except in cases when from other settings it can be safely concluded that it is better to turn it on.
        Parameters:
        cameraOptimizedForNearScanning - whether camera parameters should be optimized for near object scanning.

      • getHelpAction

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Runnable getHelpAction()
        Description copied from interface: HelpIntentUIOptions
        Returns the Runnable that will be invoked when user presses the help button on the scanning UI. For more information, see HelpIntentUIOptions.setHelpAction(Runnable).
        Specified by:
        getHelpAction in interface HelpIntentUIOptions
        Returns:
        the Runnable that will be invoked when user presses the help button on the scanning UI.

      • setHelpAction

        public void setHelpAction(@Nullable
                          java.lang.Runnable helpAction)
        Description copied from interface: HelpIntentUIOptions
        Defines action that will be executed when user presses the help button. If not set or set to null, pressing help button will invoke Intent set by HelpIntentUIOptions.setHelpIntent(Intent). If neither help Intent nor help action is set, help button will not be shown in the scanning UI. If both are set, then this action has priority, i.e. help intent set with HelpIntentUIOptions.setHelpIntent(Intent) will be ignored. Note that since Runnable cannot be serialized and transferred via Intent, this makes only sense if using RecognizerRunnerFragment with compatible overlay. An attempt to save to Intent using UISettings.saveToIntent(Intent), a IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        setHelpAction in interface HelpIntentUIOptions
        Parameters:
        helpAction - Runnable that will be invoked when user presses the help button on the scanning UI.
